FuncDef:
The abs-pfc priority enable command enables dragonfly antilocking PFC for interface queues in a dragonfly profile.
The undo abs-pfc priority enable command disables dragonfly antilocking PFC for interface queues in a dragonfly profile. The abs-pfc priority enable command enables dragonfly antilocking PFC for interface queues in a dragonfly profile. The undo abs-pfc priority enable command disables dragonfly antilocking PFC for interface queues in a dragonfly profile. By default, dragonfly antilocking PFC is disabled for interface queues in a dragonfly profile. This command is supported only on the CE8850-SAN, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P and CE8850-HAM.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the index of a queue for which dragonfly antilocking PFC is enabled.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 5.

Specifies the buffer threshold for dragonfly antilocking PFC to take effect.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 512. The unit is KB and the default value is 0.

ExtraInfo: On a lossless network with direct connections, you can run this command to enable dragonfly antilocking PFC for interface queues in a dragonfly profile.
